components.description:
Meow! A friendly, cartoon-styled face of a cat, looking straight ahead. Generally depicted as a yellowish-orange cat face with pointed ears and whiskers.

May be used with a more affectionate tone than the full-bodied 🐈 Cat, though their applications generally overlap.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Vendors implement the same or similar cat in their 🐈 Cat as well as in their cat-faced variants of smileys:

  • 😼 Cat Face With Wry Smile
  • 😹 Cat Face With Tears of Joy
  • 🙀 Weary Cat Face
  • 😾 Pouting Cat Face
  • 😿 Crying Cat Face
  • 😻 Smiling Cat Face With Heart-Eyes
  • 😺 Grinning Cat Face
  • 😸 Grinning Cat Face With Smiling Eyes
  • 😽 Kissing Cat Face

Google’s cat face was previously orange, Samsung’s gray, and Facebook’s once gray and white. Included in the earliest Japanese emoji sets from Softbank, Docomo, and au by KDDI.

title: Cat Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal faces
emoji_net_data.definition: The face of a cat, looking directly forward. Shown as yellow or gray on most platforms, this emoji generally has a cartoon-style appearance  http://emojipedia.org/cat-face/
emoji_net_data.name: cat face

bn:00090742v: Of a cat, to make its cry.

bn:00090604v: Indicate pleasure by purring; characteristic of cats

bn:00054399n: Cat communication is the transfer of information by one or more cats that has an effect on the current or future behavior of another animal, including humans.
The sound made by a cat (or any sound resembling this)
The act of producing a mew sound.
Meow, also known as Meow the fat cat, was a male domestic cat who attracted international attention due to the effort to slim him down.

bn:00061787n: Animal kept for companionship and a person's enjoyment

A pet is an animal kept primarily for a person's company or protection, as opposed to working animals, sport animals, livestock, and laboratory animals, which are kept primarily for performance, agricultural value, or research.
An animal which is kept in the home as a companion and treated affectionately.
An animal kept as a companion.
A domesticated animal kept for companionship or amusement

bn:00049269n: A kitten or kitty is a juvenile domesticated cat.
